attributes.title: 2021 BMW X7 M50i

attributes.description:
Mercedes points the way to the future, especially in safety and technology.
New C-Class is larger than before, with a longer wheelbase aimed at providing extra legroom in the rear, there's more headroom back there as well. Clever design that includes more aluminium in the body means it's about 40 kg lighter than the outgoing C-Class. It goes without saying the new C-Class has the highest safety rating of five stars. 
New Mercedes C-Class is larger than the E-Class of a couple of generations back. Such is the march of progress that it's also smoother, quieter and more powerful than its well regarded ancestor. 
The diesel 2.1-litre C220 model makes 125kW/400Nm and goes to 100km/h in 8.1sec. It has a claimed fuel combined consumption of four litres/100km and 113g/km CO2 emissions.
Handling is impeccable, with so much in hand that only the most undisciplined of drivers is even remotely likely to get into trouble. Even then, the ham-fisted driver will have found their car doing everything it could to bring matters under control again. 
This specific C220 has the following Extras
Avantgarde interior, Avantgarde exterior, Parking package, Mirror package, Reversing camera, Blind spot assist, Active parking assist with Parktronic, Windscreen wiper with rain sensor, 9G-Tronic, Electrically folding exterior mirrors, LED Intelligent Light   System and Boot auto closing.

Finance available and
Trade ins welcome
attributes.title: 2017 Mercedes-Benz C-Class C 220 Bluetec Avantgarde Auto
